snippet: A shortage of female directors in competition, the film “Timbuktu,” the return of Jean-Luc Godard, and a young director’s suicide were part of the opening-day buzz at the Cannes Film Festival.
abstract: Manohla Dargis Critic's Notebook; Cannes International Film Festival opens, with buzz focusing on shortage of female directors in competition, film Tibuktu, return of Jean-Luc Godard and a young director's suicide.
lead_paragraph: A shortage of female directors in competition, the film “Timbuktu,” the return of Jean-Luc Godard, and a young director’s suicide were part of the opening-day buzz at the Cannes Film Festival.

headline.print_headline: Sommeliers Decanting the Madness of Cannes
headline.main: Sommeliers Decanting the Madness of Cannes
